roleset.name: speak unclearly, under one's breath
roleset.note: MUTTER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'mutter' based on sentences in brown. Verbnet entry (from mutter.01-v predicate notes)
MUTTERING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-5, mutter-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls manner_speaking-37.3. (from muttering.01-n)

example.name: no listener
example.text: Ramsey-1 has [a thing or two]-2 *trace-1* to mutter about *trace-2* himself.

example.name: all args
example.text: She muttered in a low but intense voice, to herself, ``I hate that woman inside me''!
example.arg: in a low but intense voice

example.name: only subject
example.text: He-1 put the basket down distastefully, *trace*-1 muttering softly and thoroughly disgusted with himself and his plan that had seemed so foolproof.

example.name: arg1
example.text: We will hear the occasional muttering about how it happened and Miliband will throw it in his face occasionally , but that 's it .
